title: Coconut Flan Recipe
description: This easy, coconut flavored flan is a crowd pleaser. My grandmother used to make this recipe in Ecuador, it's been in the family for many years.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Coconut Flan 4.3 (50) 45 Reviews 15 Photos My grandmother used to make this recipe in Ecuador, it's been in the family for many years. I'm the only one who continues to make this recipe in my family. It's the easiest dessert that you can make. I love it and I hope you will too. Submitted by Viveca DelGiorno Updated on October 7, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 15 15 15 15 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 4 hrs Total Time: 4 hrs 30 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 large flan Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 6 eggs 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 1 (15 ounce) can coconut milk 1 ½ cups whole milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 cup white sugar Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the sugar in a nonstick skillet, and slowly melt over low heat without stirring. Shake the pan by it's handle to mix, but do not stir with a spoon. When the sugar has melted, pour into a 3 quart glass baking dish, coating the bottom. In a large bowl, beat the eggs with an electric mixer until smooth. Pour in the condensed milk, evaporated milk, coconut milk, whole milk, and vanilla; mix until well blended, about 2 minutes. Pour the egg mixture over the sugar in the pan. Place the pan inside of a larger dish and set in the oven. Fill the outer pan with water to 1 inch deep. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove the flan from the water bath, and refrigerate until cold, 4 hours to overnight. To serve, run a knife around the edges of the dish to loosen the flan, then invert onto a serving dish. I Made It Print 73 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 333 Calories 16g Fat 40g Carbs 10g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 333 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 20% Saturated Fat 11g 56% Cholesterol 116mg 39% Sodium 127mg 6% Total Carbohydrate 40g 15% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 39g Protein 10g 19% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 231mg 18% Iron 2mg 10% Potassium 375mg 8% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Coconut Flan 01 of 15 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 15 Photo by  RubyYeast7686 08/18/2023 This is wonderful! I grew up eating Flan de Coco in Costa Rica where they make it with a layer of grated coconut. So I added a cup of coconut to the recipe and it shot me right back to my childhood. Thank you!! 03 of 15 Photo by  mitz 01/22/2021 04 of 15 Photo by  rachels694 07/30/2020 05 of 15 Photo by  Honey Olney 03/31/2018 06 of 15 Photo by  Maria Angie Hernandez-Rivera 08/26/2017 07 of 15 Photo by  meli79belleza 12/21/2015 08 of 15 Photo by  DinaLaChef 05/03/2015 Just like in a restaurant! My fiancée loved it. I served it with a sprinkling of dried coconut flakes and blueberries. I made it for 6 servings, which filled a 8 x 10 inch pan. 09 of 15 Photo by  ac 04/13/2014 I always tough that was so difficult to make this recipe, but it's so easy and came out really good... name: Viveca DelGiorno
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Place the sugar in a nonstick skillet, and slowly melt over low heat without stirring. Shake the pan by it's handle to mix, but do not stir with a spoon. When the sugar has melted, pour into a 3 quart glass baking dish, coating the bottom.;In a large bowl, beat the eggs with an electric mixer until smooth. Pour in the condensed milk, evaporated milk, coconut milk, whole milk, and vanilla; mix until well blended, about 2 minutes. Pour the egg mixture over the sugar in the pan. Place the pan inside of a larger dish and set in the oven. Fill the outer pan with water to 1 inch deep.;Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove the flan from the water bath, and refrigerate until cold, 4 hours to overnight.;To serve, run a knife around the edges of the dish to loosen the flan, then invert onto a serving dish.
